t: Isaiah 3
God Will Remove the Leaders
For*pn behold, the Lord God*s of hosts is going to remove from Jerusalem and Judah Both*ln supply and support, the whole supply of bread And*ln the whole supply of water;
The*ln mighty man and the warrior, The*ln judge and the prophet, The*ln diviner and the elder,
The*ln captain of fifty and the honorable man, The*ln counselor and the expert artisan, And*ln the skillful enchanter.
And*ln I will make mere lads their princes, And*ln capricious children will rule over them,
And*ln the people will be oppressed, Each*ln one by another, and each one by his neighbor; The*ln youth will storm against the elder And*ln the inferior against the honorable.
When*ln a man lays hold of his brother in his father’s house, saying,*i “You*ln have a cloak, you shall be our ruler, And*ln these ruins will be under your charge,”
He*ln will protest on that day, saying, “I*ln will not be your*i healer, For*ln in my house there is neither bread nor cloak; You*ln should not appoint me ruler of the people.”
For*ln Jerusalem has stumbled and Judah has fallen, Because*ln their speech and their actions are against the Lord,*s To*ln rebel against His glorious presence.
The*ln expression of their faces bears witness against them, And*ln they display their sin like Sodom; They*ln do not even*i conceal it.*i Woe*ln to them! For*ln they have brought evil on themselves.
Say*ln to the righteous that it*i will*i go*i well with*i them,*i For*ln they will eat the fruit of their actions.
Woe*ln to the wicked! It*i will*i go*i badly with*i him,*i For*ln what he deserves will be done to him.
O*ln My people! Their oppressors are children, And*ln women rule over them. O*ln My people! Those who guide you lead you*i astray And*ln confuse the direction of your paths.
God Will Judge
The*pn Lord*s arises to contend, And*ln stands to judge the people.
The*ln Lord*s enters into judgment with the elders and princes of His people, “It*ln is you who have devoured the vineyard; The*ln plunder of the poor is in your houses.
What*ln do you mean by crushing My people And*ln grinding the face of the poor?” Declares*ln the Lord God*s of hosts.
Judah’s Women Denounced
Moreover,*pn the Lord*s said, “Because the daughters of Zion are proud And*ln walk with heads held high and seductive eyes, And*ln go along with mincing steps And*ln tinkle the bangles on their feet,
Therefore*ln the Lord will afflict the scalp of the daughters of Zion with scabs, And*ln the Lord*s will make their foreheads bare.”
In*p that day the Lord will take away the beauty of their*i anklets, headbands, crescent ornaments,
dangling earrings, bracelets, veils,
headdresses, ankle chains, sashes, perfume boxes, amulets,
finger rings, nose rings,
festal robes, outer tunics, cloaks, money purses,
hand mirrors, undergarments, turbans and veils.

Now*pn it will come about that instead of sweet perfume there will be putrefaction; Instead*ln of a belt, a rope; Instead*ln of well-set hair, a plucked-out scalp; Instead*ln of fine clothes, a donning of sackcloth; And*ln branding instead of beauty.
Your*ln men will fall by the sword And*ln your mighty ones in battle.
And*ln her gates will lament and mourn, And*ln deserted she will sit on the ground.
